Let's skip that version for now. We could copy/paste that method and change codes, but as this plugin is not that popular, let's wait.

原因是：Since 6.6.0, SkyWalking cancelled the local span and exit span register. If old java agent(before 6.6.0) is still running, and do register to 6.6.0+ backend, you will face the following warning message.

所以就会出现这个告警：class=RegisterServiceHandler, message = Unexpected endpoint register, endpoint isn't detected from server side.

解决方法如下：/skywalking/config/log4j2.xml
新增一个规则：
`<logger name="org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.register.provider.handler.v6.grpc.RegisterServiceHandler" level="ERROR"/>`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3932827/85491474-31377b00-b606-11ea-8859-4ade13e23b7a.png)

完整配置如下：
`    <Loggers>
		<logger name="org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.register.provider.handler.v6.grpc.RegisterServiceHandler" level="ERROR"/>
        <logger name="org.eclipse.jetty" level="INFO"/>
        <logger name="org.apache.zookeeper" level="INFO"/>
        <logger name="io.grpc.netty" level="INFO"/>
        <Root level="info">
            <AppenderRef ref="RollingFile"/>
        </Root>
    </Loggers>`
If you want something, pleae contribute. We don't do like this in the open source.
You should provide a good format issue. This is basic politeness.
In the 8.x, there is no register, so no id. All information has been encoded in the role id already.
We run the tests based on this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/tree/master/test/plugin/scenarios/mysql-scenario. You could check and debug the agent. Welcome to provide the pull request to fix.
